sub_title: Junior project manager subsidies at Ruber Acia | International Business student at the Hanze University of Applied Sciences |
summary:
I am a driven International Business student in my final year at Hanze University of Applied Sciences, possessing a blend of academic and professional experiences in cross-border collaborations, financial management, and customer service. I have honed my skills in subsidy project management, playing a key role as a project assistant in the Startup Ems-Dollard-Region, a cross-border cooperation project that bridges the gap between startups and academic institutions in the Dutch and German regions.

With a minor in Accounting & Finance from OST Fachhochschule, St. Gallen, Switzerland, and proficiency in German, I've developed a comprehensive understanding of the European business landscape. Currently, as a Junior Project Manager at Ruber Acia, a leading Subsidy advice Institution, I handle a diverse set of responsibilities from supporting consultants with grant applications and managing customer interactions, to seeking new subsidies.

I'm eager to contribute my insights on a larger scale as I prepare for my upcoming thesis project: analysing Ruber Acia's potential role as a European-level subsidy intermediary. Feel free to connect as I am always open to new opportunities and discussions!

school.name: Hanzehogeschool Groningen / Hanze University of Applied Sciences Groningen

projects.title: Market Entry Research - Drenth Holland BV
projects.description:
Commissioned by Drenth Holland BV, me and four others students produced a market entree research. Three nations (France, US and UK) were considered, in which France deemed to have the most favourable market environment for the organization to breach out in. In this project I managed to learn to following:

∙ In the process of the project I was taught to consider the new economics of the world due to the considerable influence they possess
∙ Through extensive market research I managed to learn how to apply statistical data within a research more accurately
∙ I was able to apply the marketing theories to develop a greater understanding on the economical potential of a nation

IB Professorship Intern at Hanze University of Applied Sciences | Assistant Druggist at Kruidvat
Digital District Manager at ADP | Digital Transformation | Global Payroll | Human Capital Management

projects.title: TOPSIM Logifix Inc.
projects.description:
Logifix Inc. is a simulated organization in a program called TOPSIM. As the new board of the company the goal is to develop a supply chain strategy to guide the firm out of its' crisis. Within my position I managed to acquire the following knowledge:

∙ Due to the limited amount of time in which we had to calculate, analyse and decide everything, this project taught me how to efficiently manage time, communicate and apply process automation while optimising
∙  The game was supply chain management oriented. This taught me several skills such as operations management,  inbound - and outbound -logistics
∙ All actions in the game directly influence your budget, this resulted in learning how to develop a critical decision-making process that is supported by your developed company strategy.

Digital District Manager at ADP | Digital Transformation | Global Payroll | Human Capital Management

projects.title: Balance Score Card
projects.description:
In the Balance Score Card project myself, and three others performed a financial analysis of the multinational enterprise: Emirates. In the process of this project I managed to acquire the following skills:

∙ Through the calculation of a complete ratio -, a time-series - and cross sectional -analysis  I developed an understanding of how to interpret the outcomes, and how to act accordingly on them
∙ By calculating and studying the Cash Conversion Cycle of the organization, I managed to gain knowledge on how to use this tool to create a more efficient cash flow
∙ Studying the capital structure (leverage, bonds & stocks) resulted in knowledge how to utilize leverage and why it is a crucial component of a financial dossier

contributors.headline: Junior project manager subsidies at Ruber Acia | International Business student at the Hanze University of Applied Sciences |
Projectmanagement junior consultant at Ruber Acia

projects.title: Talent Management Implementation
projects.description:
The project goal was to develop a talent management strategy for a new production site located in Emden, Germany. In the development process, I managed to acquire the following knowledge as scrum master within the project:

∙ Human Research secondary data taught me how to develop a Job analysis, onboarding plan, retention, and implantation plan.  
∙ Intercultural competencies taught me the importance of cultural assimilation and internal cultural values of an organization
∙ EU/Dutch/Geman employment law taught me how to develop an ethical code of conduct & the importnace of safeguarding of equity

contributors.headline: Junior project manager subsidies at Ruber Acia | International Business student at the Hanze University of Applied Sciences |

profile_positions.description:
• Investigating grant opportunities: involves identifying and researching grants at local, regional, national and international level
• Preparing subsidy applications: collecting the necessary information and preparing the application documents
• Collaborating with project teams: further development and improvement to ensure that the proposals meet the criteria of the subsidy provider
• Initiating communication: maintaining contact with grant providers, but also with internal stakeholders such as project leaders and financial departments
• Report on the progress of grant applications: concerns the preparation of updates and progress reports for management and other parties involved
• Follow up on grants awarded: monitor the use of the grant and ensure that all conditions/obligations are met, including reporting requirements
• Documentation and administration: complete administration of grant applications, correspondence, reports and outcomes
profile_positions.title: Junior project manager subsidies

profile_positions.description:
• Facilitate permanent physical RSO Groningen space, train new RSO interns, oversee all RSO activities until complete hand-over and assist manager with higher-level tasks and collaborations.
• Planning, preparing and leading meetings of Hanze team/Project groups. Assist in preparing advisory board meetings and keep track of the Work Packages. In addition, organizing networking events and other events.
• Collaborating and communicating with the other five offices in the Ems-Dollart-Region.
• Recruiting entrepreneurs/prospects to participate in the project
• Prepare declarations, keep track of budget overview (and make sure partners are aware
of these matters)
• Maintaining all social media platforms. The tasks include but are not limited to
developing social media posts (events, mentor programs, and podcasts), increasing social media presence, improving the SEO of the website in collaboration with the
communications officer.
• Supporting, contributing and overseeing RSO intern research activities related to the
topic area.
profile_positions.title: Project Assistant

profile_positions.description:
The “Startup Ems-Dollart Region” project initiated by the International Business professorship, aims to stimulate cross-border cooperation between start-ups in the North of the Netherlands and North-West of Germany. Within my position I am responsible for:

∙ Maintaining and further developing of marketing initiatives, including the management of the Startup Ems-Dollart-region social media platforms 
∙ Analyzing needs and wishes of the startup community in the EDR region
∙ Supporting and being involved in research activities related to finding success factors for startup           ecosystem building
∙ Collaborating and communicating with the other five offices in the Ems-Dollart-region (Leeuwarden, Drenthe, Oldenburg, Emden, Lingen)
profile_positions.title: Regional Office Intern Groningen

profile_positions.description:
Within the position as a baker, I was responsible for:

∙ Maintaining a clean, organised inventory and curating displays of weekly/season offerings
∙ Anticipating customer needs, providing them with high-quality service while upholding brand standards and values to ensure customer satisfaction
∙ Memorising 200+ items and rotating specials in order to give customer recommendation requests
∙ Maintaining and enforcing strict and up-to-date HACCP policies to ensure product quality
∙ Maintaining in-store safety by following and obtaining an emergency response certificate

volunteer_experiences.role: Student Representative of the Participation Council
volunteer_experiences.description:
Within my role as the student representative of the participation council at CSG Comenius, I was responsible for:

∙ Transforming 4,000+ opinions over five locations into coherent proposals
∙ The realisation of a new canteen that focusses on providing healthier food options
∙ New time tables that emphasised decreased work pressure for teachers and a more efficient way of teaching
